title: High-resolution Mapping of Obscured Greenhouse Gases
text:
High-resolution Mapping of Obscured Greenhouse Gases
Carbon-I will quantify greenhouse gas (GHG) fluxes from point to global scales and deliver actionable data on emission sources.






Carbon-I fills the data hole in the humid tropics







The humid tropics are hardly observed by current satellites







CH4 emissions are heterogenous across the globe, highest in the tropics.







Carbon-I will investigate hotspots and flux heterogeneity globally.









Carbon-I fills the data hole in the humid tropics
The humid tropics are hardly observed by current satellites
CH4 emissions are heterogenous across the globe, highest in the tropics.
Carbon-I will investigate hotspots and flux heterogeneity globally.

title: Christian Frankenberg
text: Christian Frankenberg is Professor of Environmental Sciences & Engineering (ESE) at Caltech and works on the global carbon cycle.

title: Christian Frankenberg
text:
Education

PhD in Environmental Physics | University of Heidelberg, Germany | 2002 - 2005
Diploma in Geoecology | University of Bayreuth, Germany | 1996-2002

title: Christian Frankenberg
text:
Professional Experience

2018-present: Professor, Caltech
2015-2018: Associate Professor, Caltech
2010-present: Scientist, Earth Atmospheric Science, JPL
2006- 2009: VENI Postd at SRON-Netherlands Institute of Space Research\
